meanings.definition: The state of being left behind after something has been removed or lost.
meanings.sent1: The remanence of the cake was the only evidence of the delicious treat that once existed.
meanings.sent2: The remanence of the old building could still be seen in the form of its crumbling walls.
meanings.sent3: As the party ended, only the remanence of laughter and joy lingered in the air.
meanings.sent4: The remanence of her perfume filled the room long after she had left.
meanings.sent5: The remanence of his presence haunted her, like a ghost from the past.

meanings.definition: The quality of being enduring or persistent.
meanings.sent1: Her remanence in the company was a testament to her dedication and hard work.
meanings.sent2: The remanence of his love for her never faded, even after all these years.
meanings.sent3: The remanence of his stubbornness made her smile, knowing he would never change.
meanings.sent4: His remanence in the community was like a rock, unwavering and solid.
meanings.sent5: The remanence of her kindness touched everyone she met, leaving a lasting impact.

meanings.definition: The act of remaining or staying behind.
meanings.sent1: His remanence at the bus stop surprised his friends who thought he had left.
meanings.sent2: The remanence of the students in the classroom indicated they had extra questions.
meanings.sent3: The remanence of the team after the game showed they were discussing their strategy.
meanings.sent4: The remanence of the guests at the party suggested they were enjoying the music.
meanings.sent5: The remanence of the leaves on the tree signaled the arrival of autumn.
